newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan PM says has no plan to redenominate yen.
newsitem.headline: Japan PM says has no plan to redenominate yen.

text.p: Japan has no plan to redenominate the yen, Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto told a parliamentary committee on Tuesday.
"Taking into account most citizens' familiarity with the yen, and the technical difficulties of redenomination, we do not intend to consider it at present," Hashimoto said.

The question was raised by a Hideyuki Aizawa, a member of Hashimoto's Liberal Democratic Party, who said the time may be right to redenominate the yen. He said it was widely believed that such a move would have an effect in stimulating economic activity.
